message_1:
Solve the following inequality and express the solution set in interval notation:

2x + 1 > 5x - 8
message_2:
To solve the inequality, we first want to get all the x terms on one side of the inequality. We can do this by subtracting 2x from both sides:

2x - 2x + 1 > 5x - 2x - 8

1 > 3x - 8

Now, we want to isolate the x term. We can do this by adding 8 to both sides:

1 + 8 > 3x - 8 + 8

9 > 3x

Finally, we can divide both sides by 3 to solve for x:

9/3 > 3x/3

3 > x

In interval notation, this solution can be written as:

(-âˆž, 3)
